results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.

results.title: Flame within
results.brief_description: A silent film consisting of a montage of images of family, friends, childhood and home juxtaposed to the words passion, freedom and home - each word with its meaning defined in text.

results.title: TV subtitles
results.brief_description: Angry and frustrated when a hotel did not provide tv’s with tv suibtitles, Robert took matters into his own hands to fight for the rights of people with special needs. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Signs of understanding
results.brief_description: Kris Chapman talks about the ACMI/Vicdeaf Project, its purpose and of the six deaf/hearing impaired people chosen to take part and contribute their stories and thoughts. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: I live again
results.brief_description: A moving story of how one man’s life was completely turned inside out when he suffered a stroke resulting in a loss of hearing. With subtitles.

results.title: My journey to strength
results.brief_description: Hilda suffers from deafness and here she gives a frank account of the ups and downs in her life and the traumatic effect of losing her mum just before she turned 18. Through support and determination she has survived years of depression and finally found happiness and acceptance. With subtitles.

results.title: The Provincial connection
results.brief_description: Giancarlo came to Melbourne on board a ship in 1965 at the age of 15 and started work. By the age of 21 he had bought his first house. Giancarlo is now the president of the Ballarat Italian Association and celebrates “the positive contribution of Italians to Australia”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: The Boy from Taurianova
results.brief_description: Rocco arrived from Calabria in 1962 at the age of 19 and immediately started his working life on a potato farm in Ballarat. He lovingly dedicates this story of his life to his daughter Connie. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Next generation
results.brief_description: As the daughter of migrant parents Nella often felt “different and isolated from the other children at school”. Her strict father did not allow her to experience some of the advantages life in Australia had to offer so Nella was determined that her own daughter would have what she couldn’t. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
